sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"抛，投，掷"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: throw, cast, fling, heave, hurl, pitch, toss
means: throw ： 普通用词，使用广泛，仅指用力抛掷，不涉及动作方式或感情色彩。
cast常可与throw互换，指迅速扔出一个重量较轻的物体。
fling ： 指用力投掷，或因感情激动而粗暴地或漫无目的地扔东西。
heave ： 指把重物举起后扔出。
hurl ： 通常指用力投掷，动作迅猛，所投掷的距离也较远。
pitch ： 指随意地、轻轻地掷或扔，侧重方向性和有明确的目标。
toss ： 指无什么目的地、轻轻地、随意地掷或扔，所扔掷的东西一般都比较轻。

word_mean: 沥青：从焦油和其他物质蒸馏后取得的黑色、有光泽带粘性的残渣
音高，音调：主要由频率决定的音质和音色

sentence.Network_en: Footballers in whopping great studded boots walk over the pitch.
sentence.Network_cn: 脚蹬帅气钉靴的足球运动员走进了球场。

sentence.Network_en: Campaigning is reaching fever pitch for elections on November 6.
sentence.Network_cn: 为11月6日选举进行的竞选活动逐渐达到白热化。

sentence.Network_en: The ground staff do all they can to prepare the pitch.
sentence.Network_cn: 运动场管理员全力整备球场。

音调( Pitch)： 改变音调（Pitch）值，可以减速/加速音频剪辑的播放。1是正常播放速度。

同问求高人分解完美音调（pitch perfect）里女主角面试时做的那段杯子动作！ 有地址发地址要不发我邮箱！

点距（dot pitch）（DOT PITCH）是指荫罩板上两个最接近的同色荧光点之间的直线距离。点距（dot pitch）是显像管最重要的技术参数之一，他的单位为毫米。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 使劲干，投入：精力充沛地投入工作

jx.jx_cn_mean: 协力，做贡献：配合他人；帮助或合作

jx.jx_cn_mean: 猛烈攻击：口头或武力攻击；攻击

phrase.cizu_name: pitch on  或 pitch upon 【非正式用语】

jx.jx_en_mean: To succeed in choosing or achieving, usually quickly
jx.jx_cn_mean: 选出，决定，选定：成功且常是迅速地选定或实现

(informal)vigorously join in to help with a task or activity

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)（起劲地）干工作，着手处理

jx.jx_en_mean: (Cricket)bowl a ball so that it bounces near the batsman

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as a verb in the senses 'thrust (something pointed) into the ground' and 'fall headlong'): perhaps related to Old English picung 'stigmata', of unknown ultimate origin. The sense development is obscure
Old English pic (noun), pician (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch pek and German Pech; based on Latin pix, pic-

entry.tran: （足球、板球、曲棍球等运动的）球场
entry.def: A pitch is an area of ground that is marked out and used for playing a game such as football, cricket, or hockey.

example.ex: There was a swimming-pool, cricket pitches, playing fields...
example.tran: 有一个游泳池、几个板球场和运动场。

example.ex: Their conduct both on and off the pitch was excellent.
example.tran: 他们场上场下都表现出众。

entry.tran: （通常指仔细瞄准后用力）投，掷，扔，抛
entry.def: If you pitch something somewhere, you throw it with quite a lot of force, usually aiming it carefully.

example.ex: Simon pitched the empty bottle into the lake.
example.tran: 西蒙把空瓶子扔到湖里。

entry.def: To pitch somewhere means to fall forwards suddenly and with a lot of force.

example.ex: The movement took him by surprise, and he pitched forward...
example.tran: 这一动使他冷不防地向前摔倒。

example.ex: Alan staggered sideways, pitched head-first over the low wall and fell into the lake...
example.tran: 艾伦身子倒向一侧，一头栽过矮墙，跌进了湖里。

entry.def: If someone is pitched into a new situation, they are suddenly forced into it.

example.ex: They were being pitched into a new adventure...
example.tran: 他们正被抛入一场新的冒险。

example.ex: This could pitch the government into confrontation with the workforce.
example.tran: 这有可能把政府推向与工人正面交锋的境地。

entry.tran: （棒球或跑柱式棒球运动中）把（球）投给击球员
entry.def: In the game of baseball or rounders, when you pitch the ball, you throw it to the batter for them to hit it.

example.ex: We passed long, hot afternoons pitching a baseball.
example.tran: 我们通过投棒球玩打发了一个个漫长、炎热的下午。

entry.def: The pitch of a sound is how high or low it is.

example.ex: He raised his voice to an even higher pitch.
example.tran: 他把音调抬得更高了。

entry.def: If a sound is pitched at a particular level, it is produced at the level indicated.

example.ex: His cry is pitched at a level that makes it impossible to ignore...
example.tran: 他的哭喊声之大让人没法不理睬。

example.ex: His voice was pitched high, the words muffled by his crying...
example.tran: 他的声音很高，嘴里的话因哭泣而含混不清。

entry.tran: 把…定（在特定的水平、难易程度等上）
entry.def: If something is pitched at a particular level or degree of difficulty, it is set at that level.

example.ex: I think the material is pitched at too high a level for our purposes...
example.tran: 我想相对于我们的意图来说，内容定得过难了。

example.ex: The government has pitched High Street interest rates at a new level.
example.tran: 政府已设定了新的商业利率水平。

entry.def: If something such as a feeling or a situation rises to a high pitch, it rises to a high level.

example.ex: I feel very sorry for the competitors who have all worked themselves up to a very high pitch for this first day...
example.tran: 我为第一天就已耗费相当大体力的参赛者感到非常惋惜。

example.ex: Tension has reached such a pitch that the armed forces say soldiers may have to use their weapons to defend themselves against local people.
example.tran: 紧张关系已达白热化程度，武装部队说士兵有可能不得不使用武器保护自己不受当地民众的伤害。

entry.def: If you pitch your tent, or pitch camp, you put up your tent in a place where you are going to stay.

example.ex: He had pitched his tent in the yard...
example.tran: 他在院子里搭起了帐篷。

example.ex: At dusk we pitched camp in the middle of nowhere.
example.tran: 黄昏时分，我们在茫茫荒野中扎了营。

entry.tran: （船只在海浪中）上下颠簸，纵摇
entry.def: If a boat pitches, it moves violently up and down with the movement of the waves when the sea is rough.

example.ex: The ship is pitching and rolling in what looks like about fifteen foot seas.
example.tran: 这只船在看起来约有15英尺高的海浪中上下左右颠簸。

entry.def: Pitch is a black substance that is sticky when it is hot and very hard when it is dry. Pitch is used on the bottoms of boats and on the roofs of houses to prevent water getting in.

example.ex: The timbers of similar houses were painted with pitch.
example.tran: 类似房屋所用的栋木刷了沥青。

entry.def: If someone makes a pitch for something, they try to persuade people to do or buy it.

example.ex: The President speaks in New York today, making another pitch for his economic program...
example.tran: 总统今天在纽约发表讲话，再一次为他的经济计划作宣传。

example.ex: Prue invited the magazine's editor to lunch and made her pitch.
example.tran: 普吕邀请该杂志的编辑共进午餐，推销自己的点子。

means.word_mean: 1. the property of sound that varies with variation in the frequency of vibration
2. (baseball) the throwing of a baseball by a pitcher to a batter
3. a vendor's position (especially on the sidewalk);

sentences.sentence: "he was employed to see that his paper's news pitches were not trespassed upon by rival vendors"

means.word_mean: 4. promotion by means of an argument and demonstration
5. degree of deviation from a horizontal plane;
6. any of various dark heavy viscid substances obtained as a residue
7. a high approach shot in golf
8. an all-fours game in which the first card led is a trump
9. abrupt up-and-down motion (as caused by a ship or other conveyance);

sentences.sentence: "the pitching and tossing was quite exciting"

means.word_mean: 10. the action or manner of throwing something;

sentences.sentence: "his pitch fell short and his hat landed on the floor"

means.word_mean: 1. throw or toss with a light motion;
2. move abruptly;

sentences.sentence: "The ship suddenly lurched to the left"

means.word_mean: 3. fall or plunge forward;

sentences.sentence: "She pitched over the railing of the balcony"

means.word_mean: 4. set to a certain pitch;
5. sell or offer for sale from place to place
6. be at an angle;
7. heel over;
8. erect and fasten;
9. throw or hurl from the mound to the batter, as in baseball;
10. hit (a golf ball) in a high arc with a backspin
11. lead (a card) and establish the trump suit
12. set the level or character of;

sentences.sentence: "She pitched her speech to the teenagers in the audience"

example.en: He'll make a pitch for solar energy.
example.zh: 他将竭力为利用太阳能作宣传。

auth_sentence.content: He would run right across the pitch with it.
auth_sentence.res_content: He would run right across the pitch with it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He would run right across the pitch with it.

auth_sentence.content: Despite events on the pitch the mood was upbeat.
auth_sentence.res_content: Despite events on the pitch the mood was upbeat.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Despite events on the pitch the mood was upbeat.

auth_sentence.content: Even for his age he gets around the pitch.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even for his age he gets around the pitch.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even for his age he gets around the pitch.

means.word_mean: 球场

sentences.en: The crowd invaded the pitch at the end of the match.
sentences.cn: 比赛结束时人群涌入球场。

means.word_mean: 音调, 音高

sentences.en: Her voice has a very high pitch.
sentences.cn: 她说话声调很高。

means.word_mean: 程度; 强度; 高度

sentences.en: Disagreement reached such a pitch that we thought a fight would break out.
sentences.cn: 意见分歧达到我们以为会争吵起来的程度。

means.word_mean: 沥青

sentences.en: They used pitch to cover roofs.
sentences.cn: 他们用沥青涂盖屋顶。

means.word_mean: 颠簸

sentences.en: The pitch of the ship threw the passengers off balance.
sentences.cn: 轮船上下颠簸, 使乘客失去了平衡。

means.word_mean: 斜度, 坡度

sentences.en: The roof has a sharp pitch.
sentences.cn: 这屋顶很陡。

means.word_mean: 商贩摊位, 艺人表演场地

sentences.en: He has a pitch on the High Street where he sells souvenirs.
sentences.cn: 他在大街上有个卖纪念品的摆摊处。

means.word_mean: 推销商品的话

sentences.en: He has a very clever sales pitch.
sentences.cn: 他推销商品的口才很好。

means.word_mean: 投, 掷, 扔

sentences.en: He was pitching the ball.
sentences.cn: 他正在投球。

means.word_mean: 为…定音调

sentences.en: This song is pitched too high for my voice.
sentences.cn: 对我的嗓子来说, 这首歌的音定得太高了。

means.word_mean: 用人们易懂的方式表述

sentences.en: He pitched his speech so that even the children could understand.
sentences.cn: 他带着一种特殊的表情讲话, 以便孩子们能听懂。

means.word_mean: 排列；定顺序；把…定在；把…定得

sentences.en: The program was pitched at just the right level.
sentences.cn: 大纲所定水平恰到好处。

means.word_mean: 把…定于特定角度；使倾斜

sentences.en: The carpenters pitched the roof steeply.
sentences.cn: 木匠把屋顶造得过于陡斜。

means.word_mean: 把…定于特定程度(或价值、性质、标准等)

sentences.en: The general's speech was pitched as a call to arms.
sentences.cn: 将军的讲话是一个要大家拿起武器的号召。

means.word_mean: 使带有特定感情地说(或写)

sentences.en: They pitched a story about finding the jewels.
sentences.cn: 他们编造了一个找到宝石的故事。

means.word_mean: 使摔倒；使丢失

sentences.en: The boat overturned and the passengers were pitched out.
sentences.cn: 船翻了，乘客被摔了出来。

means.word_mean: 搭(帐篷), 扎(营)

sentences.en: They pitched at the foot of the mountain.
sentences.cn: 他们在山脚下扎营。

sentences.en: They pitched a camp in the mountain.
sentences.cn: 他们在山中扎营。

means.word_mean: (使)突然向前倒下

sentences.en: His foot caught in a rock and he pitched forwards.
sentences.cn: 他的脚被岩石绊了一下, 身子就朝前倒下。

means.word_mean: 颠簸

sentences.en: The ship pitched and rolled and many passengers were sick.
sentences.cn: 那轮船颠簸摇晃, 很多乘客头晕恶心。

means.word_mean: 向下倾斜

sentences.en: The roof of this house pitches sharply.
sentences.cn: 这房子的屋顶倾斜度很大。

jushi.english: They pitched at foot of the mountain.
The Arab stopped and pitched in the desert.
jushi.chinese: 这个阿拉伯人停下来,然后在沙漠中搭起了帐篷。

jushi.english: The ship pitched and rolled and many passengers were sick.
jushi.chinese: 那轮船颠簸摇晃,很多乘客头晕恶心。
